intro: Barleria candida, commonly known as white barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Barleria candida is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
